fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
MSSQL and PostgreSQL DBs require to run maintenance job regularly to update statistics on the database. Not doing this leads to using the wrong plan by the query optimizer and this later causes slow performance for Select queries. See JSWSERVER-15917 and JRASERVER-63002 as an example.  

Quote
bq. Our DBA is updating the statistics on the two tables every hour between the hours of 6am and 11:59:59PM. He was also more aggressive in the index maintenance that runs nightly at 2am performing more index rebuilds (which automatically updates all statistics on the table the index supports) instead of performing index reorgs.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the "Connecting Jira applications to a database" docs, specifically pages:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-postgresql-938846851.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2017-970613480.html  

and mentioned the need to run maintenance job daily. 
We can use examples from related KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/optimize-and-improve-postgresql-performance-with-vacuum-analyze-and-reindex-885239781.html

for MS SQL:
{noformat}
Daily for hot tables - UPDATE STATISTICS <table.name>
Weekly for all Jira DB - UPDATE STATISTICS with fullscan;   
{noformat}

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: [Documentation] Include recommendation to run DB maintenance job daily

fields.description:
Current Project Import does not retrieve data for Boards/Charts. 

Burndown Chart  we need after migration does not work for 2 reasons :

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the "Average Time in Status" gadget is returning the issues selected by UPDATED and not the issues resolved as mentioned at the own link at the graph
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Atlassian Add-on "Jira Charting Plugin" (we used v 3.0)
 # Create a new custom field, search for type time in status, then, name it "Time in status" (Please ensure that there is only one defined).
 # Re-index
 # Create a sample project SCRUM with data
 # Select some issues with different Statuses and add single comments on them
 # Create a filter "Allissues" to select all issues from project SCRUM,
 # Add the Gadget "Average Time in Status" on a dashboard
 # Configure the Gadget to use the filter "Allissues" and selected one status, for instance, "In Progress";
 # Observe the graph. It will show spikes to the day of the execution. At the bottom of the graph, it shows the link "This chart shows the average time spent in a status for all resolved issues over the past 30 days."
 # Click on the link. It will show all the issues returned by the filter "Allissues"
 # Click on one of the Dots on the graph

h3. Expected Results

Open the Issue Navigator showing all the resolved issues on that day
h3. Actual Results

We see all the Issues updated that day, with all the status (not only the resolved one).
h3. Workaround

Modify the filter adding "statusCategory = Done", then only the resolved issues will be listed

If this is the new expected behavior, the text at the link should be updated to show something like "This chart shows the average time spent in a status for all issues *updated* over the past 30 days."
fields.summary: Average time in Status gadget is selecting updated issues and not resolved issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attaching a large GIF file to an Issue slows down the entire system
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to ⚙️ → System → Attachments → Edit Settings
 # Increase the 'Attachment Size' to 20MB
 # Attach a large GIF file to a issue For e.g. tried with a 15MB file
 # Jira will eventually slow down the entire Jira on accessing any page

Screen recording of the issue replication [^Issue_Replication_steps.mp4]

Adding a sample large GIF file in zip format [^Sample Large GIF.zip]
h3. Expected Results

Jira should handle a large GIF file as any other attachment format
h3. Actual Results

Attaching a large GIF file will eventually slow down the entire Jira on accessing any page
h3. Workaround

Remove this attachment entry from the database
 * Take a database backup using native tools
 * Fetch the issue id
{code:SQL| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#F4F5F7 |bgColor=#F4F5F7}
select id from jiraissue where summary like '%_____%' --add the ticket summary where the GIF was attached
{code}

 * Fetch the problematic issue
{code:SQL| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#F4F5F7 |bgColor=#F4F5F7}
select * from fileattachment where issueid = '______' --add the id from the above sql{code}

 * Delete this entry
{code:SQL| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#F4F5F7 |bgColor=#F4F5F7}
delete from fileattachment where issueid = '______' --add the id from the above sql{code}

 * Delete file from the file system, follow KB [Locate Jira server file attachments in the filesystem|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/locate-jira-server-file-attachments-in-the-filesystem-859487788.html]
 * Restart Jira
fields.summary: Attaching a large GIF file to an Issue slows down the entire system

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When removing users/groups from *Bulk Change* Global Permission, this removes the Bulk link from the navigation menu and issue navigator.

However, users still see *Bulk operation* under the sub-tasks panel. This leads them to the regular Bulk Operations interface but results in a 404 page in the last step.

This creates confusion for users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 - Created a "Bulk Permission" group and enabled bulk operations only for this group.
 # Step 2 - Tested sub-tasks issue bulk options logged as a member from "Bulk Permission" group and logged as a non-member of this group

h3. Expected Results

Only "Bulk Permission" group members should see the bulk operations option. Users with a direct link (e.g. bookmark) to the Bulk Operations page should be prompted with a permission denied error.

h3. Actual Results

All users can see the bulk operations option in the sub-tasks panel, regardless of the Global Permission. This doesn't allow them to use the functionality though.

h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users without Bulk Change Global Permission receives a 404 error instead of a permission error

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to have an option to only allow a specific email address domain (only from @atlassian.com, for example) to be used when creating a user manually.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I'd like to have an option to only allow a specific email address domain to be used when creating a user manually

fields.description:
We observed that Jira has the option of advanced properties that can control the number of comments that got collapsed with the parameter _"jira.comment.collapsing.minimum.hidden"_. *However*, this parameter lets us control the number of comments that collapse, but not the number of comments that are shown after they are collapsed.

Making some tests, we believe that the amount of issues that are shown after the comments are collapsed is 5, without change with different numbers in the _"jira.comment.collapsing.minimum.hidden"_. parameter.

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 11.48.55 AM-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 11.47.44 AM-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 11.46.42 AM-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 11.40.44 AM-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27.png|thumbnail! 

The only option for showing more than the last 5 comments is that we disable the feature of the collapsing, or that we set the number of collapsing so high that may not work for some cases.

With that said, I would like to suggest the creating of a parameter or an option in Jira to control the number of comments shown before collapsing them.

Best Regards,
{color:#0065ff}Benedy Melo{color} | _Atlassian Support_
fields.summary: Create option for the number of visible comments

fields.description:
Jira offers nifty Bitbucket [workflow triggers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/blog/2015/07/workflow-automation-triggers] for automatically transitioning issues when merging a PR.

But in more complex developer workflows ([Gitflow|https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/comparing-workflows/gitflow-workflow] for example), this is not enough to track commits as they progress.

If a team might want to transition an issue from "In Development" to "Testing" when a commit referencing the Jira issue is merged to "develop". Likewise, a team might want an automatic transition from "Testing" to "Deployed" when the commit is merged to "main".

The current workflow triggers do not inspect the target branch of a merge but instead treat all merges the same.

We need more granular transitions, nowadays, it is not possible.
fields.summary: Increase branch qualifiers on Pull Requests for Workflow Triggers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Security team confirms, Jira captcha is very easy and able to read with OCR. 

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results
- Currently captcha looks like [^captcha.jfif] . However, this needs to be complex and not able to read by ocr. 

h3. Workaround
- No known workaround.
fields.summary: Jira captcha is very easy and able to bypass captcha easily

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow unauthenticated remote attackers to display arbitrary messages in the application via an injection vulnerability in the XSRF token error page.

The affected versions are before version 8.5.14, and from version 8.6.0 before 8.12.1.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.14
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.12.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.14
 * 8.12.1
fields.summary: Unauthenticated users can inject messages into the XSRF token error page

fields.description:
At the moment, if a directory fails to synchronise in JIRA, you will not be notified until either you are alerted to this fact by a user in your tenancy or perchance, you self-discover it for another reason.

As directories already have known synchronisation schedules/timeframes (and also, average run times that estimations could be based upon), it would be fantastic if periodically, Jira validated whether directories:
 * had successfully run in the last X timeframe
 * has synchronised in a similar timeframe to previous synchronisation events

Implementation of a feature here would:
 * provide a better experience for users
 * help discovery and resolution of directory related issues speed up
fields.summary: JIRA's health checks should monitor whether directories successfully synchronised within their most recent timeframe

fields.description:
Currently, in Jira, users will be able to create boards as long as they have been granted the *Create Shared Objects* global permission.

However, this can lead to multiple versions of the same board being created, renamed, and slightly altered. You can also create multiple boards with the same filter, and this ends up cluttering the *Boards* section of Jira Software.

If Administrators could restrict board creation based on certain conditions, they would be able to prevent this from happening.
fields.summary: Allow Jira System Administrators to impose conditions to create a board.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, there is no way to configure filter subscriptions byweekly, for example, set it up to occur every Tuesday.
You can configure it:
- Daily
- Days per week
- Days per month
- Advanced (CRON expression)

You can configure it so it runs every first and 15th day of the month, but the day of the week it happens will vary. Cron expressions do not natively support the "every two weeks" time period as well.
fields.summary: Allow filter subscription notifications to be sent byweekly

h3. Issue Summary
When cloning an issue with sub-tasks, if it contains a sub-task with 255 characters, the operation will fail with an untreated DB exception

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a task on Jira
# Associate it with a sub-task with a 255 character long summary
# Clone the task, checking the option to clone its sub-tasks.

Jira should warn that there's a sub-task that exceeds the limit of characters for the summary field, which is automatically appended to "CLONE - "

fields.description: Hello.  Currently the only way to utilize IntelliJ IDEA autocompletion for Jira api groovy scripting is with a scriptrunner integration, but there are multiple reasons why one would not be able to go down that path, using the open source option or otherwise.  Having api reference integration for popular IDEs as part of the SDK or a separate API kit would be very handy and a welcome addition to the rich feature set of Atlassian products.  I'm sure this would be handy for the other core products as well.
fields.summary: API reference for intellij

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the page [Integrating with OAuth 2.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/integrating-with-oauth-2-0-1013845729.html] the following steps regarding the endpoint and the redirect URL doesn't cover the differences between using multi-tenant or single-tenant endpoints:
{quote}5, For Google and Microsoft, we will auto-fill the authorization and the token endpoint data. However, if you are using a custom service provider, you need to obtain this data from the service provider and fill it in yourself.

6. Copy the generated redirect URL, which you’ll have to provide at the service provider’s site to obtain the client ID and client secret.
{quote}
Also, the redirect URL generated is using a multi-tenant by default.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be useful to have a warning regarding the differences on this page, as many users look into setting up this config. with a single tenant.
fields.summary: Update: Integrating with OAuth 2.0

fields.description:
Currently, in directory configuration, under User Schema Settings, we have an option User Name Attribute. 

During the migration, if we want to change the User Name Attribute for only few users we do not have this ability. Once we change the attribute, it affects all the users. 

There should be a way by which we can impact a group of users with the change in User Name Attribute.

The affected versions are before version 8.17.0.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.17.0

*Fixed versions:*

fields.description:
It would be a good solution giving Jira system administrators the option to configure known protocols by themselves, by having this option as a default feature from the tool, it would avoid scenarios where they must do a workaround that can expose them to Cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

Here is an URL example:
notes://EXEMPLE-C14/E1111EE1111E1E1E/1EEE11E11111E111E11111E1111111EE/11111111111111E1E111111111111E11E1
fields.summary: Allow Jira administrators to configure protocols to be used on URL fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Workflow transition order not respected in *Board > Issue Details > More Actions..*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any *Board* (KANBAN, Scrum backlog, etc)
 # Click on any issue on the board to display the *Issue detail*on the right panel
 # Click *... > More Actions...* menu
 # Observe that workflow transition order is not respected in the *Operations* dropdown pop-up window

h3. Expected Results

Workflow transitions should be in sequence of {{action id}}
h3. Actual Results

Workflow transitions doesn't seem to be in any particular order.

Request: {{rest/api/1.0/issues/<issue_id>/ActionsAndOperations}}
 Reply:
{code:json}
{"id":"<issue_id>",
"key":"<issue_key>",
"viewIssue":"View Issue",
"atlToken":"<token_id>",
"actions":[{"action":"21","name":"Selected for Development"},{"action":"41","name":"Done"},{"action":"11","name":"Backlog"},{"action":"31","name":"In Progress"}],
...}
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Workflow transition order is not respected in Operations dropdown pop-up window

fields.description:
Currently, translated request types cannot be searched on the customer portal.

The request types can be translated and the translated version will show in the list, but they cannot be searched on in the search bar in another language.
fields.summary: Searching for translated request types and portals on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Being able to bulk change the 'Status name to show the customer' field without needing to change workflow may be useful for the customer, and that is not available today.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to perform a bulk change to that, across projects that use the same workflow.
fields.summary: Make 'Status name to show the customer' bulk editable.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Even though you can't create duplicate issue type with the same name through Jira UI or REST API, Jira still allows this through Java APIs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue type called "Test"
 # Install [Xray|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211769/xray-test-management-for-jira?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] or [Zephyr|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1014681/zephyr-for-jira-test-management?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]


h3. Expected Results

Jira stops the creation of "Test" issuetype as it already exists

h3. Actual Results

* Jira allows duplicate issuetype to be created
!image-2021-04-21-17-01-25-691.png|thumbnail! 
* Jira issue search with {{issuetype = "Test"}} will only show the issues of the lower issuetype ID

h3. Workaround

Follow KB [Jira issue search doesn't fetch all issues when there are duplicate issue types|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-issue-search-doesn-t-fetch-all-issues-when-there-are-duplicate-issue-types-1014276812.html]
fields.summary: Java API allow creating duplicate issue types

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira supports Java 11 starting from version *8.2*. See docs - [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver082/supported-platforms-973503809.html]  and related announcement [Java 11 / OpenJDK support update for Server and Data Center products|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Agile-articles/Java-11-OpenJDK-support-update-for-Server-and-Data-Center/ba-p/967836#M392]

Availability of Java LTS versions (from https://adoptopenjdk.net/support.html):
* Java 8 (LTS)  till at least May 2026
* Java 11 (LTS) till at Least Oct 2024
* Java 17 (LTS) starting from Sep 2021 

h3. Suggested Solution
Ship AdoptOpenJDK JRE 11 with Jira installer. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Install a supported version of Java 11 manually
fields.summary: Ship OpenJDK Java Release 11 by default with Jira

fields.description:
While I'm aware of things like the \\{noformat} tag and backslash-escaping autoformatting (which I had to do for the noformat tag), this gets REALLY tedious to have to do on a lot of the workload for people pasting in lots of shell output, code snippets etc who are more interested in efficiently communicating than poking around (with a mouse, slowing things down even further) in the UX for space-wasting macro blocks for two or three lines of output.

Please create a user preferences toggle "Disable auto-formatting in all text fields" to work around this problem.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Create user-facing toggle to disable all autoformatting in WYSIWYG editor

 - How the selection affects the operators available in JQL and 
 - How this selection affects the availability of the field in dashboard gadgets (such as statistical ones) 
 - Any potential performance impacts based on the type of field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Issue clicked to view from Kanban board, adds the "cf[10000]" in JQL and throws an error as {color:red}"Field 'cf[10000]' does not support sorting"{color}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Kanban Board
 # Select any Issue > Right Click > View in Issue Navigator

!kanban-board-1.png|thumbnail!

 !jql-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

It should display the selected Issue view.

 !expected-jql-before-813.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

It adds an cf ID '10000' in the above JQL to sort as 'ORDER BY' and fails with an error.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Concurrent project creation based on *shared configuration* can result in all Issue Types within the project's Issue Type Scheme being removed. 

(i) It seems that the association itself remains ({{optionconfiguration}}), however, the link to that association is gone ({{fieldconfigschemeissuetype}})

(!) This may not have been introduced in 8.15.0, it was simply the version used to test

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Testing environment: Jira 8.15.0, Postgres 9.6.20-1, single node DC
 # Create a SCRUM project named TEST
 # Under Jira Admin -> Issues -> Issue type schemes, observe the 5 Issue Types associated with "TEST: Scrum Issue Type Scheme"
# Start concurrently *creating projects based on Shared Configuration* of project TEST
## This can be done via Java API, or, via createprojectbasedonsharedconfiguration HTTP resource
## Example for HTTP resource approach {code}#!/bin/bash
COUNTER=0
while [ $COUNTER -lt 20 ]; do
    echo Created number $COUNTER
   curl -u admin:admin 'http://localhost:48150/j8150/rest/project-templates/1.0/createshared/10000' -H 'Accept: */*' -H 'Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw "{\"key\":\"TEST${COUNTER}\",\"name\":\"TEST${COUNTER}\"}"  > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo 
    let COUNTER++
done{code}
## Partial snippet using JAVA API: {code}
ProjectManager projectManager = ComponentAccessor.getProjectManager();
ProjectService projectService = ComponentAccessor.getComponent(ProjectService);

final ProjectService.CreateProjectValidationResult result = projectService.validateCreateProjectBasedOnExistingProject();
final Project newProject = projectService.createProject(result);
{code}


h3. Expected Results
Projects are created, and the TEST:Scrum Issue Type Scheme lists the 5 Issue Types, along with assigned projects. 

h4. Database - Good (scheme ID 10400 is good)
{code}
select * from fieldconfigscheme where fieldid = 'issuetype'
<SNIP>
10400	"KAN: Kanban Issue Type Scheme"		"issuetype"	
10601	"TEST: Scrum Issue Type Scheme"		"issuetype"	

select * from fieldconfigschemeissuetype where fieldconfigscheme = 10400 
10502	NULL	10400	10400

select it.pname, oc.* from optionconfiguration oc  join issuetype it on oc.optionid = it.id where oc.fieldid = 'issuetype' AND oc.fieldconfig = 10400

"Epic"	10508	"issuetype"	"10000"	10400	4
"Task"	10504	"issuetype"	"10001"	10400	0
"Sub-task"	10505	"issuetype"	"10002"	10400	1
"Story"	10506	"issuetype"	"10100"	10400	2
"Bug"	10507	"issuetype"	"10101"	10400	3
{code}

h3. Actual Results
Projects are created, however the 5 issue types under TEST: Scrum Issue Type Scheme are gone, replaced by _No issue types associated_

 !image-2021-04-20-16-07-27-274.png|thumbnail! 

It is not possible to create new issues, as neither the project selector shows, nor the issue type  list in order to create an issue. 

*Database - Broken (scheme id 10601 is broken)*
{code}
select * from fieldconfigscheme where fieldid = 'issuetype'
<SNIP>
10400	"KAN: Kanban Issue Type Scheme"		"issuetype"	
10601	"TEST: Scrum Issue Type Scheme"		"issuetype"	

select * from fieldconfigschemeissuetype where fieldconfigscheme = 10601
[Empty Set]

select it.pname, oc.* from optionconfiguration oc  join issuetype it on oc.optionid = it.id where oc.fieldid = 'issuetype' AND oc.fieldconfig = 10601

"Epic"	10608	"issuetype"	"10000"	10601	4
"Task"	10604	"issuetype"	"10001"	10601	0
"Sub-task"	10605	"issuetype"	"10002"	10601	1
"Story"	10606	"issuetype"	"10100"	10601	2
"Bug"	10607	"issuetype"	"10101"	10601	3
{code}

(*) The options are still there and associated, however, the scheme is missing it's {{fieldconfigschemeissuetype}} row. 

h4. Log files
The line below is repeated from a variety of sources. It appear to be whenever the "options" (issuetype assignments) are loaded by something:
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException: config

    java.lang.NullPointerException: config
    	at java.base/java.util.Objects.requireNonNull(Objects.java:246) [?:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.option.CachedOptionSetManager.getOptionsForConfig(CachedOptionSetManager.java:51) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.IssueTypeSystemField.getOptionsForConfig(IssueTypeSystemField.java:641) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.IssueTypeSystemField.getOptionsForConfig(IssueTypeSystemField.java:637) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.IssueTypeSystemField.getOptionsForIssue(IssueTypeSystemField.java:633) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.IssueTypeSystemField.validateParams(IssueTypeSystemField.java:411) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.quickedit.action.QuickCreateIssue.validateProjectAndIssueType(QuickCreateIssue.java:441) [?:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.quickedit.action.QuickCreateIssue.validateIssueTypeAndProject(QuickCreateIssue.java:430) [?:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.quickedit.action.QuickCreateIssue.doDefault(QuickCreateIssue.java:205) [?:?]
    	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:?]
    	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:?]
    	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:?]
{code}

h3. Workaround
In the example above, it was possible to restore the issue type scheme association by:
# Obtain the broken Issue Type Scheme ID with {code}select * from fieldconfigscheme where fieldid = 'issuetype'{code}
# Verify the scheme is mising it's {{fieldconfigschemeissuetype}} association (0 rows) by {code}select * from fieldconfigschemeissuetype where fieldconfigscheme = <ID> {code}
# Verify the option assignments are still infact there: {code}select it.pname, oc.* from optionconfiguration oc  join issuetype it on oc.optionid = it.id where oc.fieldid = 'issuetype' AND oc.fieldconfig = <ID>{code}
# Insert the missing row back into {{fieldconfigschemeissuetype}} table, then restart Jira. We will need to obtain a valid and unique {{id}} value, since this table's sequences are defined in-application, not by a database sequence (a database backup / staging instance could help here)
fields.summary: Concurrent project creation based on shared configuration results in all Issue Types within the project's Issue Type Scheme being unassigned

From https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14294:
 It is possible to add "all watchers" in the notification scheme for Issue Created. However, it is only possible to add watchers to an issue after the issue is created, so the watchers will not receive an email notification about the creation of an issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

You can configure the following setting in Notification Scheme.
 !jira-notification-scheme-created-watcher.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

We can't configure that setting because we can add watchers only after reporting an issue.

h3. Actual Results

We can configure that setting.

There is no workaround now. Keeping in mind this setting is never triggered.

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to edit an image file like .png or .jpeg directly in Jira. There are already many JS libraries that could support this.
Such a feature would help us a lot and reduce the effort for editing.
Until the switch from Server to DataCenter we had the plugin "Image Annotator". It is unfortunately no longer available and the server version of course does not work.

Example:
1. user uploads test.png.
2. assignee edits the image by clicking on it and an overlay opens. In this overlay he can now add symbols, texts etc. to clarify work tasks in this image.
Assignee saves the image and Jira automatically adds it back to the ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to edit an image file

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

The current implementation of Jira Service Management requires unauthenticated outbound REST API call from the App to Jira.

These calls are {{/server-info}} and {{/rest/nativemobile/1.1/info/login}} and are described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/can-t-check-compatibility-error-in-the-jira-server-mobile-app-954244691.html

Some customers may have a WAF, proxy, or other appliance in between the client App and Jira that block unauthenticated access to these calls

Solutions include:
* Configure the third party service to exclude  or otherwise unblock these URLs
* Use MDM to implement the "skipInfo" flag as decscribed in https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/mobile-device-management-mdm-993923036.html

However, some customers may not be able to use either option, since MDM is not used, or the third party service cannot be configured (either for business, or technical reason) to exclude the required URLS. 

This results in inability to use the Jira Mobile App. 

h3. Suggest solution
Redesign the pre-login phase of JMA to not require unauthenticated call
fields.summary: Skip unauthenticated API requirement for Jira Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While execution of automation rule, rule was executed twice 
- During creation of issue
- During editing the issue
Both the times, custom field is updated with the same value. The same value is appended to the existing one. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Rule1: Triggered on Create issue if label XYX exists update custom-field
# Rule2: Triggered on Edit issue if label XYZ exists update custom-field
# If user create a new issue, both rules executes. Basically, create issue rule is adding label,
Which is triggering the Edit issue automation rule. In this case both are updating the same custom field.

h3. Expected Results
# Custom field should have single value. 

h3. Actual Results
# Custom field has two entries of the same value. 
# It is expected to lock the custom field for not to write the same value in second instance. 

h3. Workaround
- Configure the rule properly and use the Select dropdown to confirm the action when user want to update custom field.
fields.summary: database column should be locked while writing value in custom field

fields.description:
The Jira importers plugin AttachTemporaryFile rest resource in Jira Server and Data Center before version 8.5.12, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.4, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.15.1 allowed remote authenticated attackers to obtain the full path of the Jira application data directory via an information disclosure vulnerability in the error message when presented with an invalid filename. 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.12
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.4
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.15.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.12
 * 8.13.4
 * 8.15.1

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira uses DBCP library to manage the connection pool to DB. As part of it, it has {{validation-query}} which runs periodically to check *if connections are healthy*, so it can be used by the Java code without getting the connection error. 

In the case of a large DB pool (100+ connections) or aggressive network environment when connections to DB can be dropped frequently, the current setting of _300000 ms_ (300 sec/5 min) is too high. The thread running validation runs very infrequently and doesn't have a chance to check all connections in the pool. Details from [BasicDataSource Configuration Parameters|https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-dbcp/configuration.html]
* timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis (-1) -	The number of milliseconds to sleep between runs of the idle object evictor thread. When non-positive, no idle object evictor thread will be run. 
* numTestsPerEvictionRun (3) - The number of objects to examine during each run of the idle object evictor thread (if any).

This leads to situations that some connections are stale and expire, so later when Java code uses them, it will receive an *Error: "The last packet successfully received from the server was 34,123,456 milliseconds ago ... Caused by: java.net.SocketException: Connection reset"*
Full error:
{noformat}
2020-10-23 06:16:36,579 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN admin 376x1580x2 hpvzys 10.196.197.9 /rest/api/2/reindex [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following <Trim>
(The last packet successfully received from the server was 34,191,605 milliseconds ago.  The last packet sent successfully to the server was 34,191,607 milliseconds ago. is longer than the server configured value of 'wait_timeout'. You should consider either expiring and/or testing connection validity before use in your application, increasing the server configured values for client timeouts, or using the Connector/J connection property 'autoReconnect=true' to avoid this problem.)
java.lang.RuntimeException:  ....
...
Caused by: java.net.SocketException: Connection reset
	at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(SocketOutputStream.java:115)
	at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(SocketOutputStream.java:155)
	at sun.security.ssl.OutputRecord.writeBuffer(OutputRecord.java:431)
	at sun.security.ssl.OutputRecord.write(OutputRecord.java:417)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.writeRecordInternal(SSLSocketImpl.java:894)
	at sun.security.ssl.AppOutputStream.write(AppOutputStream.java:123)
	at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flushBuffer(BufferedOutputStream.java:82)
	at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flush(BufferedOutputStream.java:140)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.send(MysqlIO.java:3721)
	... 40 more
{noformat}

See also related KBs
* [Operations in Jira server fail with connection pool errors in logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/operations-in-jira-server-fail-with-connection-pool-errors-in-logs-718834030.html]
* [Operations in Jira server fail with communications link failure in logs with MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/operations-in-jira-server-fail-with-communications-link-failure-in-logs-with-mysql-214338032.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the Jira docs and decrease the default value of *time-between-eviction-runs-millis* to make it more frequent. 

h3. Workaround 
# Change values manually in the {{dbconfig.xml}} file:
#* {code:java}
 <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>30000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>{code}
#  Save the file and restart Jira.
fields.summary: Make Jira DBCP connection refresh checks more frequent

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In some organizations, there's a group of Jira admins who mostly do user and application management (create projects, screens, custom fields, etc...)

These users shouldn't be allowed to re-index Jira. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Restrict indexing to system admin. The admins would still get a pop-up when indexing is needed but they need to notify a system admin to know when to run it. 
h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Restrict indexing to system admins

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Jira is connected to Delegated LDAP, users that are already deleted from LDAP side cannot be disabled in Jira

h3. Environment
* Delegated (Internal with LDAP Authentication) LDAP

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Jira to an LDAP with Delagated permission
# Login to Jira as one of the user from the Delegated LDAP
# Create some content in Jira
# Logout
# Remove/delete this user from LDAP side

h3. Expected Results
# User can be disabled in Jira

h3. Actual Results
The user cannot be disabled in Jira. There is no edit button for users coming from Delegated LDAP.
Even if we recreate the user from LDAP, we still cannot disable the user in Jira side.
!result.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
# Disable the user manually by running the following database SQL query:
{code}
UPDATE cwd_user SET active = '0' where user_name = '<the username that we'd like to disable>';
{code}
(!) Please always backup your database before performing any alteration in the database side.
# Restart Jira > Run Full reindexing
fields.summary: Unable to disable users from Delegated LDAP when the users are removed from LDAP side

fields.description:
The service.bat script uses tomcat8.exe to create the service.

It would be helpful to add {{--LogLevel Debug}} to it so we would get more verbose logging.

The current last few lines would look like this:
{code:bash}
"%EXECUTABLE%" //IS//%SERVICE_NAME% ^
    --Description "Atlassian Jira 8.16.0" ^
    --DisplayName "Atlassian Jira" ^
    --Install "%EXECUTABLE%" ^
    --LogPath "%CATALINA_BASE%\logs" ^
    --StdOutput auto ^
    --StdError auto ^
    --Classpath "%CLASSPATH%" ^
    --Jvm "%JVM%" ^
    --StartMode jvm ^
    --StopMode jvm ^
    --StartPath "%CATALINA_HOME%" ^
    --StopPath "%CATALINA_HOME%" ^
    --StartClass org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap ^
    --StopClass org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap ^
    --StartParams start ^
    --StopParams stop ^
    --JvmOptions "-Djava.awt.headless=true;-Datlassian.standalone=JIRA;-Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true;-Dmail.mime.decodeparameters=true;-Dorg.dom4j.factory=com.atlassian.core.xml.InterningDocumentFactory;-XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow;%GC_JVM_PARAMETERS%;-XX:InitialCodeCacheSize=32m;-XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=512m;-Dcatalina.home=%CATALINA_HOME%;-Dcatalina.base=%CATALINA_BASE%;-D%ENDORSED_PROP%=%CATALINA_HOME%\endorsed;-Djava.io.tmpdir=%CATALINA_BASE%\temp;-Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager;-Djava.util.logging.config.file=%CATALINA_BASE%\conf\logging.properties;%JvmArgs%" ^
    --JvmOptions9 "--add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED#--add-opens=java.base/java.io=ALL-UNNAMED#--add-opens=java.rmi/sun.rmi.transport=ALL-UNNAMED" ^
    --Startup "%SERVICE_STARTUP_MODE%" ^
    --JvmMs "%JvmMs%" ^
    --JvmMx "%JvmMx%" ^
    --LogLevel Debug
if not errorlevel 1 goto installed
echo Failed installing '%SERVICE_NAME%' service
exit /b 1
:installed
echo The service '%SERVICE_NAME%' has been installed.
exit /b 0
{code}

Another option would be to do it over a flag in the script arguments.
fields.summary: Enable debug for tomcat8.exe on service.bat

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When calling the REST API endpoints starting with {{/rest/agile/1.0/board/}} the value set for the query parameter maxResults is not taken into account if it is bigger than '50' (it always return 50). The parameter startAt works fine instead.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call any {{agile/1.0/board}} endpoint passing a value for maxResults that is lower than 50
 # See that this works fine. E.g. <JIRA_BaseURL>/rest/agile/1.0/board?maxResults=20
 # Call the same endpoint passing a value for maxResults that is bigger than 50.
 E.g. <JIRA_BaseURL>rest/agile/1.0/board?maxResults=100

h3. Expected Results

The maxResults value in the REST response is correctly set to the desired value
h3. Actual Results

maxResult is always set to 50, if the instance has 1000's of boards it will be a tedious job to retrieve the records and also might be difficult to plan for any automations related to Agile board related operations.

The same issue reproduces calling:
 - /rest/agile/1.0/board
 - /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/project
 - /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/epic
 - /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/sprint

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Use the pagination approach and use startAt parameter to get the required results in slots of 50 everytime.
fields.summary: When calling the REST API endpoints starting with /rest/agile/1.0/board the value set for the parameter maxResults is not taken into account if it is bigger than '50' (it always return 50). The parameter startAt works fine instead.

fields.description:
Currently, users often believe that they should be able to *Manage Sprints* on a certain board, but in reality, the original board of the active sprint displayed is a completely different board. 

This behavior causes major confusion and several support requests and it could be prevented if, along with the greyed out, *Manage Sprints* button, the original board of a sprint was displayed in Jira's user interface.

That would allow users/administrators do correctly diagnose this behavior more efficiently.
fields.summary: The Original Board of an Active Sprint should be displayed in the User Interface

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We would like to be able to get the plain text of a wiki field. 
Using the /rest/api/2/issue/<issueId>?fields=<field>&expand=renderedFields, we can get an HTML result from the wiki field content, however, we would need to work this result using a parser like html2text, for instance, to get the plain text.

We need another expand option that could return the plain text of a wiki field. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new Issue
* At the description field, add some test using markup options like bold, italic, bullets, etc
* Call the REST API to get the content of this field
http://l<jira base url>/rest/api/2/issue/PS74995-3?fields=description&expand=renderedFields

h3. Expected Results
* Get the plain text of the description to be used somewhere else

h3. Actual Results
* It is not possible to get the plain text, only the markup content or a rendered result in HTML

h3. Workaround
* Use a tool like html2text to parse the results
fields.summary: Add an expand option to return plain text in the REST API for wiki fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

whenever there are plugin-related changes (like updating the plugin, enabling/disabling the plugin, install a new plugin) we see that the CDN cache is broken, and hence the page layout displayed on Jira UI is all distorted and broken. 

After invalidating the cache on the CDN front, things are working fine again. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A

h3. Expected Results
We don't refer to the old CDN cache. A new cache should be referred and the old one should be manually invalidated. 

h3. Actual Results
 page layout displayed on Jira UI is all distorted and broken. 
No exceptions in the logs. 

h3. Workaround
Manually invalidating the cache on the CDN front resolves the problem.
fields.summary: Upgrading a plugin makes CDN cache unusable and has to be manually invalidated

It would be helpful for this field to be expanded.

 

Thanks!

h3. Currently:
Current JIRA integration with Bitbucket (and I expect GitHub and/or other DVCSs) allows to make multiple smart commits on a feature branch using Jira issue keys, but they're all separated from each other.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Cannot sort the Linked Issues in the Issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Verify if the issue Link is turned on.
 # Create an issue named "Issue-1".
 # Create three more issues with different types named "Issue-2", "Issue-3", "Issue-4"
 # Link the later issues to "Issue-1"
# Verify in System> advanced settings if "jira.view.issue.links.sort.order" is set to order the issues by type and status.

h3. Expected Results
If you enter the "Issue-1" you should see a list of issues linked to it, and those issues be sorted by the parameters set in "jira.view.issue.links.sort.order".

h3. Actual Results
The issues do not appear sorted by type, but by status.

h3. Workaround
If searched and ordered by type, the issues will appear normally.

------------
I created a new instance and tested the sort feature.
# I created 20 issues with different types, and status.
# I linked all the issues to the 1st issue created.
# Made all the verifications as described above and set the type and status as the parameters of "jira.view.issue.links.sort.order".
# I got the following results:
 !Linked issues view sorted.png|thumbnail!

As you can see, the issues are still sorted by "status" instead of "type".
fields.summary: Sorting issues by issue type doesn't work on issue view

fields.description:
Jira Rest Endpoint "*/rest/api/2/project*" should have an option to add query parameter "components" to filter out projects based on components.
 - Currently there is no REST method available at the moment that does projects filtering based on "*projectCategory*".

 - We need to call */rest/api/2/project* and then iterate returned projects checking if there is projectCategory for the current project and comparing projectCategory name or ID.

 - In order to overcome the above scenario and provide ability to search(filter) projects using "*projectCategory*", we should include an option in the rest endpoint to include this as query parameter.

This will help larger organisations who work on segregating projects based on category.
fields.summary: Jira Rest Endpoint "/rest/api/2/project" should have an option to add query parameter "components" to filter out projects based on components.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There is a bug in Jira that intermittently allows users to trigger bulk edit operations for the *Epic Link* field even if sub-tasks are included within the dataset selected:

[JRASERVER-72283 - Validator for the Epic Link field fails intermittently for bulk edit operations involving sub-tasks|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72283]

If you try to complete the operation, it will fail while displaying a NullPointerException.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select a group of issues that includes sub-tasks via JQL.
 # Click on *Tools* > *Bulk change all issues*.
 # Select all issues, click on *Next*.
 # Select the *Edit issues* operation.
 # Select the *Epic Link* field and insert an Epic.
 # You may need to repeat this process a few times, as the validator fails intermittently.

h3. Expected Results
* A validator should prevent the operation from being triggered.
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-02 at 20.49.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The user is able to trigger the operation, but it fails with a NullPointerException
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-02 at 21.04.03.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Bulk Edit operation for the Epic Link field fails with a NullPointerException if sub-tasks are included

The purpose of test environments is to test new features and troubleshooting issues. However, we usually see JVM parameters being introduced to prevent these environments from sending/receiving messages. 

It would be nice if a feature was introduced that allowed Jira administrators to natively bypass these parameters with certain mail accounts for troubleshooting purposes.

However, when the same transition to Done action is performed for the subtasks from the issue details page, the same popup does not appear.

!image-2021-04-02-16-34-05-633.png!

This request is to have the same behaviour observed in agile boards to also be implemented in the issue details page screen.
fields.summary: Show update parent issue screen in issue details page when all subtasks are done

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a Jira issue screen (Create Issue screen, Edit Issue screen) contains a "Select List (single choice)" custom field verifying the following conditions below, the screen will take a long time to load (for example, 15s-30s):
- the field contains a *high number of option* (for example 10k)
- a big portion of these options is *disabled*

Depending on the browser type and version, there will either be a spinning wheel displayed in the UI until the screen loads, or the browser will freeze until the screen loads.

h3. Environment

Not replicable on Jira 7.x. 
Replicable on any Jira version from 8.0.0

h3. Steps to replicate

- Install Jira 8.13.0
- Add the the add-on [Data Generator for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210725/data-generator-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] to this Jira installation
- Use the "Generate Metadata" functionality from this add-on  create a "Select List (single choice)" custom field containing 10k values
- Create a new Core project
- Edit the edit issue screen used in this project by adding the custom field created by the add-on
- Create a new Jira issue in the project
- Stop Jira
- Log into the Jira DB
- Search for the ID of the custom field in the table _customfield_
- Once you have it, use this ID to run the following UPDATE query, in order to set the 10k option values to *disabled*
{code:java}
update customfieldoption set disabled = 'Y' where customfield = <CUSTOM_FIELD_ID>;
{code}
- Restart Jira, for these DB changes to be effective
- Open the Jira issue created earlier in the Core project
- Click on the edit button

h3. Actual results

A spinning wheel is shown in the UI for 15 seconds an eventually the "Edit issue screen" appears
 [^Jira_813_CustomField_10kOptions_AllDisabled.mov] 

h3. Expected results

The "Edit issue" screen should load within less than 1 second, as it is the case with Jira 7.13.0:
 [^Jira_713_CustomField_10kOptions_AllDisabled.mov] 

h3. Note on fix 
Since the problem is caused by slow parsing of HTML string response (with a massive amount of whitespaces), we switched to _DOMParser API_ to parse it before passing it further. This way the faulty line with `trim` method is omitted. 
Also, we spotted the same problem on the issue view page (UI was stalled for ~15 seconds). We fixed it too. (/) 

h3. Workaround
The workaround consists in:
- either reducing the number of disabled options from the select list custom field
- or removing the problematic select list custom field from the screen configuration
fields.summary: Jira issue screens are slow to load when containing a select list field with a high number of disabled options

fields.description:
+Actual behaviour:+

When trying to share a filter, we can choose to share either to anybody, or a specific group, or all members or specific roles on a project team

!image-2021-04-01-16-00-53-890.png|width=182,height=186!

+Suggested behaviour:+

It would be interesting to be able to select some specific individuals of a same team, independently from their role.
fields.summary: share filters with couple of engineers working in the same team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is unable to delete a custom field, if the Jira is setup as single node, none-clustered DC.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run Jira Software 8.16 with a datacenter license without any cluster.properties file (single node, non-clustered DC) 
 # Go to Administration > Issues > Custom Fields
 # Create a new custom field
 # Delete new custom field

h3. Expected Results

Successfully delete the custom field.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to delete the custom field with the error below.

!error.png|width=361,height=104!

{{*Data Center license required* You need a Jira Data Center license to complete this action.}}

No exception found in the log files.
h3. Workaround

In order to pass Data Center license check, creating a cluster.properties file with a *jira.node.id* and *jira.shared.home* resolved the issue. Because of the new shared home folder, Jira software installation was needed.
fields.summary: Deleting custom field gives "Data Center License Required' error

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

 As of now, you are only able to view the "Date" value in the "Created/Updated" filter

!1.png|thumbnail!  

In order to view the time as well, you will need to hover on the "Created/Updated" column in the filter in order to get the time value.

!hover.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Suggested Solution*

Allow the configuration of allowing time to be viewed at a glance without the need to hover.
h3. *Why this is important*

This helps the user to get a better view of the issue and grasp the period of when the issue has been created/updated.
fields.summary: The ability to have Date & Time appear in the filter column together

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to play any video attachment on issues by clicking on them using *Google Chrome or Safari*, the video doesn't start playing and returns http status code 302.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # We have installed a fresh Jira Software Instance on version 8.16 (Affected Version) and also we installed a fresh Jira Software instances on versions 8.15.1, 8.15.0, 8.14.1, 8.14.0 and 8.13.4 only for troubleshooting purpose.
 # Created an Project new project.
 # Created an Issue (Bug and Task) at the project created on step before.
 # Attached a .mp4 video to that issue and tried to play it on Chrome and Safari.

h3. Expected Results

It was expected that the video would start to play on both web browsers.
h3. Actual Results

The video doesn't start to play only on version 8.16 (Affected Version) and since the request doesn't contain JSESSIONID cookies (in case of Google Chrome), it will be redirected to login page with 302 http status code:
{noformat}
Request URL: http://localhost:48160/j8160/secure/attachment/10001/Test.mp4Request
Method: GETStatus Code: 302
Remote Address: [::1]:48160
Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
{noformat}
* In a nutshell there will be redirection loop

h3. Note
The problem is a functional regression that happened in Safari/Chrome after introducing {{Content-Security-Policy}} header. This is was done as part of the improvement of Jira attachment content security. 

+Details:+ 
After setting {{Content-Security-Policy}} header to {{sandbox}} value, Google Chrome treat it as "_unique origin_", see [Content Security Policy|https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/security/csp]
bq. This can have a wide range of effects on the page: forcing the page into a unique origin, and preventing form submission, among others.

And related docs [CSP: sandbox|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/sandbox]
{quote}
allow-same-origin
   Allows the content to be treated as being from its normal origin. If this keyword is not used, the embedded content is treated as being from a unique origin.
{quote}
so this prevents a browser from sending the required cookies to Jira. 

h3. Workaround

In order to enable Chrome and Safari to properly playback attachments (like videos or sounds) added to issues admin can disable a feature flag by adding a Site Wide Dark Feature called {{jira.security.csp.sandbox.disabled}}. This will disable setting header {{Content-Security-Policy}} to {{sandbox}} for attachments and other assets.
fields.summary: Video attachments stopped playing on issues in Chrome/Safari browsers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After changing a project's key, direct links to comments using the old issue key in the URL are not properly directed to the comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click the link button on an existing comment to create a link to that comment.
# Go into the project settings and change the project's key.
# Try accessing a specific comment by using the link created prior to the project key change.

h3. Expected Results
The direct link to the comment loads the comment.

h3. Actual Results
A redirect happens to the issue using the new project key, but the issue is opened ignoring the query strings in the URI pointing to the specific comment. This causes the issue to be opened as if no direct link to a comment was used.

h3. Workaround

Update old direct comment links to use the new project key.
fields.summary: Comment links using the old project key don't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Jira is using a custom jQuery version where we keep track of the jQuery critical BUGs and continually release the fixes by cherry-picking the commits from the JQuery fixed versions to our forked version of jQuery 2. For instance, some jQuery versions have medium to critical security vulnerabilities and these were addressed in Jira in the following issues:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69725
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71139
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70929

However, not all users are aware of these custom fixes and some security tools report false vulnerabilities for the current jQuery version used by Jira by comparing it to the desired fixed version.

Even though we include the details for each vulnerability fix in our security advisories, it'd be good if we can have a public document where we keep track of all the critical fixes that we are continuously patching in Jira. In this way, it would be easier for the customers to confirm that they are protected against these vulnerabilities.
fields.summary: Public documentation for the fixes included in the jQuery custom version

fields.description:
The membersOf JQL search function in Jira Server and Data Center before version 8.5.13, from version 8.6.0 before version 8.13.5, and from version 8.14.0 before version 8.15.1 allows remote anonymous attackers to determine if a group exists & members of groups if they are assigned to a publicly visible issue field.


*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.13
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.5
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.15.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.13
 * 8.13.5
 * 8.15.1
fields.summary: Information Disclosure using JQL function membersOf - CVE-2020-36286

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Personal Access Tokens (PATs) were introduced in Jira DC version 8.14.  Here is the guide to using them:
 * [Using Personal Access Tokens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/using-personal-access-tokens-1026032365.html]

In the section "Limit token creation", you can expand a list of limits you can set on the PATs.  These limitations are enacted by adding JVM arguments as listed in [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html].  _However,_ when these JVM arguments are added to the Java options for a Windows service, Jira will fail to start.  Jira _will_ start if they are added to Java 9 options. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the option "-atlassian.pats.max.tokens.expiry.days=30" to the JVM args in the Windows service. 
 # Jira fails to start. 

h3. Expected Results

Jira will start and respect the additional PAT argument. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira fails to start and the following is found in the commons-daemon log:
{noformat}
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [info] [ 7624] Apache Commons Daemon procrun (1.2.3.0 64-bit) started.
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [info] [ 7624] Running Service 'JIRASoftware190917125414'...
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [info] [ 6760] Starting service...
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [error] [ 5212] CreateJavaVM Failed with error [-1]
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [error] [ 5212] The system could not find the environment option that was entered.
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [error] [ 6760] Failed to start Java
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [error] [ 6760] ServiceStart returned 4.
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [info] [ 7624] Run service finished.
[2021-03-23 13:42:57] [info] [ 7624] Apache Commons Daemon procrun finished.
{noformat}

The following is found in the stderr log:
{noformat}
2021-03-23 13:42:57 Apache Commons Daemon procrun stderr initialized.
Unrecognized option: -atlassian.pats.max.tokens.expiry.days=30
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Setting Personal Access Token (PAT) expiration in Java options causes Jira not to start on Windows

fields.description:
Minor UX improvement: often I've got the URL of a particular Jira issue that I'd like to paste into the linked issue field, but the autocomplete widget isn't able to resolve the issue from a URL.

Would be great if that widget could strip off any query params and everything before the last path element of a URL before attempting to match an issue number.

e.g. [https://jira.mycompany.com/browse/DC_MYPROJECT-129|https://jira.mycompany.com/browse/DC_MYTI-129]   =>  DC_MYPROJECT-129

fields.description:
Hello,

We currently have an on-going bug that might affect Jira deployments running on MSSQL when collation diverges between database and instance (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65634). I believe this bug must be highlighted in deployment documentation such as:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-azure-sql-976765780.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2016-948232141.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2017-970613480.html

It has to be clear that the MSSQL Server instance collation MUST be one of the supported ones (SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI or Latin1_General_CI_AI) and that this needs to be the same collation used in Jira's database. During troubleshooting of ticket https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PS-75598, customer had performed the deployment and due to the collation mismatch he ended in the bug scenario.
fields.summary: MSSQL collation bug not reported on deployment documentation

the issue should be created without any errors or warnings.

h3. Actual Results
 the below exception appears in the atlassian-jira.log 
{code}
2021-03-29 16:03:22,694+0530 http-nio-48133-exec-21 ERROR testuser 963x2284x1 ydhntm 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.a.j.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Error creating issue: 
com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: You do not have permission to edit the following issues: PB-1, PROJ-1.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current REST API doesn't allow users to add an attachment when transitioning an issue. This can be problematic if a workflow has a validator requiring that an attachment be added.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a JSON field to enter a base64-encoded attachment when hitting the [Do Transition|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.13.18/#api/2/issue-doTransition] endpoint.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow users to add attachments when transitioning issues via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a Jira Administrator, I would like to be able to see *which workflows currently use any given postfunction or resolution*, so that I can modify those workflows before removing those resolutions.
h3. Problem

Once resolutions are incorporated into a workflow through postfunctions, the workflows rely on those resolutions. If the resolutions are changed drastically or removed, it could create problems for workflows that depend on those, but there isn't a way to see what those affected workflows might be before making the changes.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * There could be a page/table that shows which Resolutions are in use in each workflow.
 * There could be a page/table that shows which workflows are using each Resolution, similar to how you can see which Issue Types are valid for any given custom field.

h3. Workaround

This information can be queried from the Jira db:
 # Find the ID of the Resolution you would like to look up, by finding it in the table:
{code:java}
SELECT * FROM resolution;{code}

 # Run the following query to find the workflows that use resolutions with that ID.
 (!) Make sure to edit the ##### below to be the id chosen from step 1!
{code:java}
select workflowname from JIRAWORKFLOWS 
WHERE descriptor like '%<arg name="field.name">resolution</arg>%<arg name="full.module.key">com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.workflowupdate-issue-field-function</arg>%<arg name="field.value">#####</arg>%';{code}
fields.summary: See which workflows use which postfunctions or resolutions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cluster Index Replication health check reports false-positives when cluster and database are in different timezones.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Jira cluster in GMT+0 servers
 # Configure a database in a GMT-5 server
 # Run the instances and see the health check reports a 18,000 seconds delay in Index Replication

h3. Expected Results

The health check would compare nodes and db dates converting them to the same TZ.
h3. Actual Results

The health check compares the nodes current time (from the JVM) with the {{replicatedindexoperation.index_time}} from the database, which is stored in database local time.
 Thus the health check will always report a delay in the same amount of seconds as the timezone offset.
h3. Workaround

No current workaround aside from configuring the database and nodes to the same timezone or ignoring the alarms if they fall within the timezone offset threshold _(eg 18,000 and something seconds for a 5h difference)_. 

More details in the KB article: [Cluster Index Replication health check reports delay when the database is in a different timezone than Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Cluster+Index+Replication+health+check+reports+delay+when+the+database+is+in+a+different+timezone+than+Jira]
h3. Notes

The problem was introduced as part of [DBR|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/document-based-replication-in-jira-data-center-1021214730.html] changes in 8.12.
fields.summary: Cluster Index Replication health check doesn't work for a database in a different timezone than the nodes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira does not notify the system administrators when a node leaves a cluster. In environments with a low number of nodes, any node leaving the cluster might cause a significant increase in load for other nodes.

Being notified that a node joined the cluster would also be useful. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Send a email notification to Jira system administrators whenever a node leaves or joins the cluster.
 
h3. Workaround 
The load balancer could be configured to trigger a script or other action in order to send an email to some system admins when the number of targets change. 

Individual Jira nodes can be monitored by reviewing the response body of their *{{/status}}* endpoints.
fields.summary: As a Jira system admin, I would like to receive a notification whenever a node leaves or joins the cluster

fields.description: After deleting a branch from the source repository (Github & Gitlab), the branch still needs to be manually removed from the Jira side. If the branch is deleted from Github, it would be useful if it gets automatically removed from Jira.
fields.summary: Remove branch on Jira, when it is removed from Github (or Gitlab)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Atlassian analytics plugin attaches the header {{x-atlassian-mau-ignore: true}} to all requests generated with either {{XmlHttpRequest}} or with {{fetch}}. This creates problems if the custom code tries to send requests to external services, since extra headers in those requests might not be allowed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Try to execute a remote request to any external server within Jira frontend.

h3. Expected Results
Jira does not attach headers to requests not going to Jira server.

h3. Actual Results
Jira attaches headers to any remote requests, regardless of the destination

h3. Workaround

Remove the preprocessor hooks for XmlHttpRequest and fetch and restore the native functionality before the request to the third-party server by adding this line before the request:

{code:javascript}require('atlassian/analytics/user-activity-xhr-header').uninstall();{code}

If you need to restore preprocessor hooks for fetch and XHR after the remote request to an external service, you can do it like this:

{code:javascript}require('atlassian/analytics/user-activity-xhr-header').install();{code}
fields.summary: Analytics plugin attaches x-atlassian-mau-ignore header to all requests

fields.description:
The dashboard gadgets preference resource of the Atlassian gadgets plugin used in Jira Server and Jira Data Center before version 8.13.5, and from version 8.14.0 before version 8.15.1 allows remote anonymous attackers to obtain gadget related settings via a missing permissions check.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.13.5
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.15.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.13.5
 * 8.15.1
fields.summary: Anonymously accessible Dashboards can leak private information via configured gadgets - CVE-2020-36287

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Create Vs resolved issues report does not adhere to date format on look and feel config

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update the look and feel date format to dd/MM/YY 
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-25 at 9.37.09 am.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create a sample scrum project (SCRUM1)
 # Under the project add the report "create vs resolved issues report" with default configuration (per screenshot) 
!Screen Shot 2021-03-25 at 9.38.10 am.png|thumbnail! 
# Observe the generated report

h3. Expected Results
The generated report should contain the dates as per dd/MM/YY

h3. Actual Results
The generated report does not adhere to the dates format as per dd/MM/YY
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-25 at 9.41.50 am.png|thumbnail!

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When loading an issue, Jira gets information from every single linked issue. In cases where there are too many linked issues, overall performance to load these issues will take a hit. The Thread related to loading this issue will be reaching to the database, such as:

{noformat}
at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeQuery(SQLProcessor.java:527)
...
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.getLinks(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:343)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.lambda$new$1(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:82)
{noformat}

h3. Suggestion

Limit how many Issue Links are checked or provide a parameter to define how many records are retrieved on the initial issue loading.

h2. Workaround

Avoid having issues with thousands of Issue Links.
fields.summary: Improve performance of Issue View Page with multiple Issue Links

fields.description:
After deleting a branch or repository in the source DVCS (Github, Bitbucket, etc), the repository still needs to be manually removed from the Jira side. If the repository is deleted from DVCS, it would be useful if it gets automatically removed from Jira.

Current Behavior: If a Repository is deleted at the source DVCS and not in Jira, the only noticeable change is Jira is that the sync will fail.

Desired Behavior: If a Repository is deleted at the source DVCS, Jira should update the repo on its end to show specifically that the Repo is gone.
fields.summary: Remove repository on Jira, when it is removed from Github

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A customer is developing a dashboard item app, following the instructions here: [Writing a dashboard item app|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/writing-a-dashboard-item-app/]. If they change the title to one that contains Czech characters (e.g., *{{MyTextěščřžýáíéúůť}}*), the text displays incorrectly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a vanilla instance of Jira, with standard encoding (-Dfile.encoding=utf-8 and -Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8) in the application server and database
 # Develop a sample dashboard item, as per the document above
 # In the "dashboard-item-tutorial.js" file, in function
"DashboardItem.prototype.renderEdit" create json and save properties
like this:
preferences["TestLocalString"] = "Local chars: š š č ř ž ý á í é ú ů ť";
this.API.savePreferences(preferences);
 # In the same "dashboard-item-tutorial.js" file in the function
"DashboardItem.prototype.render" read this properties like this:
console.log("CSAS render function: "+preferences["TestLocalString"])
or set the title of dashboard:
this.API.setTitle("Name-text from preferences:
"+preferences["TestLocalString"]);
 # Create a .jar file for the dashboard item
 # Upload the .jar file to Jira
 # Create a dashboard, using a gadget from the newly uploaded .jar file

We could also reproduce the same sort of behaviour as follows:
 # Set up a vanilla instance of Jira, with standard encoding (-Dfile.encoding=utf-8 and -Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8) in the application server and database
 # Develop a sample dashboard item, as per the document above
 # In the *dashboard-item-tutorial.properties* file, set *{{com.example.plugins.tutorial.dashboard.item.title=MyTextěščřžýáíéúůť}}*
 # Create a .jar file for the dashboard item
 # Upload the .jar file to Jira
 # Create a dashboard, using a gadget from the newly uploaded .jar file

 
h3. Expected Results

The title of the dashboard should appear as *{{MyTextěščřžýáíéúůť:  !Screenshot 2021-03-24 at 14.00.05.png|width=516,height=182!}}*     
h3. Actual Results

The dashboard title shows garbled text where the accents, diacritics, etc. should be:  !Screenshot 2021-03-24 at 14.27.24.png|width=512,height=173!
h3. Workaround

Encode strings in the .properties files _to_ base64 using the *{{encodeURIComponent}}* method and then _from_ base64 using the *{{decodeURIComponent}}* method. As an example:
 - *Encode strings to BASE64 like this*:
{code:javascript}var textBase64 = btoa(encodeURIComponent("Local chars: š š č ř ž ý á í é
ú ů ť")){code}
 - *Decode strings back from BASE64 like this*:
{code:javascript}var textOrig = decodeURIComponent(atob(textBase64)){code}

*The renderEdit part is then changed like this:*
{code:javascript}preferences["TestLocalString"] = btoa(encodeURIComponent("Local chars: š š
č ř ž ý á í é ú ů ť"));{code}

*and the render part is then changed like this:*
{code:javascript}console.log("CSAS render function: "
+ decodeURIComponent(atob(preferences["TestLocalString"])) ){code}
fields.summary: Czech characters in dashboard title do not display correctly

fields.description:
The  jira.editor.user.mode cookie set by the Jira Editor Plugin in Jira Server and Data Center before version 8.5.12, from version 8.6.0 before version 8.13.4, and from version 8.14.0 before version 8.15.0 allows remote anonymous attackers who can perform an attacker in the middle attack to learn which mode a user is editing in due to the cookie not being set with a secure attribute if Jira was configured to use https.


*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.12
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.4
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.15.0

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.12
 * 8.13.4
 * 8.15.0
fields.summary: jira.editor.user.mode cookie missing the secure attribute when Jira is configured with https -  CVE-2021-26076
